Package es.courserajava.edu.duke

Class FileResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.courserajava.edu.duke.FileResource
  • public class FileResource
extends Object
    The FileResource class represents a file and allows access to its contents a line at a time, using the method lines, or a word at a time, using the method words. These strings can then be iterated over using a for loop.

    Example usage: 

     FileResource fr = new FileResource();
 for (String s : fr.words()) {
     // print or process s
 }

    If each line of the file represents separated data values, because its a CSV file, then the user can get a getCSVParser object to access that data more directly, using one of the getCSVParser methods.

    Example CSV usage: 

     FileResource fr = new FileResource("food.csv");
 for (CSVRecord record : fr.getCSVParser()) {
     // print or process fields in record
     String name = record.get("Name");
     // other processing
 }

    This software is licensed with an Apache 2 license, see http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 for details.

    Author:
    Duke Software Team

      Create a FileResource object that opens a file whose name is passed as a parameter.
      FileResource​(String filename, boolean writable)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileResource

        public FileResource()
        Create a FileResource object that opens the file chosen by the user using a file selection dialog box.
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if no file is selected by the user

      • FileResource

        public FileResource​(File file)
        Create a FileResource object that opens a file represented by the File object passed as a parameter. Useful, for example, when used in conjunction with the DirectoryResource class.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be represented by this resource
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the file cannot be accessed

      • FileResource

        public FileResource​(String filename)
        Create a FileResource object that opens a file whose name is passed as a parameter. The named file should be on the current class path to be found.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to be opened
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the filename cannot be accessed

      • FileResource

        public FileResource​(boolean writable)
        Create a FileResource object that opens the file chosen by the user using a file selection dialog box, possibly to write to it. If the user wants to change the contents of the open file by using the method write to add new strings to it, pass true as the second parameter. Otherwise it is assumed the user will only iterate over the existing contents of the file.
        Parameters:
        writable - allow changes to this file only if true
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if no file is selected by the user

      • FileResource

        public FileResource​(File file,
                    boolean writable)
        Create a FileResource object that opens a file represented by the File object passed as a parameter, possibly to write to it. If the user wants to change the contents of the open file by using the method write to add new strings to it, pass true as the second parameter. Otherwise it is assumed the user will only iterate over the existing contents of the file. Useful, for example, when used in conjunction with the DirectoryResource class.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be represented by this resource
        writable - allow changes to this file only if true
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the file cannot be accessed

      • FileResource

        public FileResource​(String filename,
                    boolean writable)
        Create a FileResource object that opens a file whose name is passed as a parameter, possibly to write to it. If the user wants to change the contents of the open file by using the method write to add new strings to it, pass true as the second parameter. Otherwise it is assumed the user will only iterate over the existing contents of the file. The named file should be on the current class path to be found.
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file to be opened
        writable - allow changes to this file only if true
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if the filename cannot be accessed

    • Method Detail

      • lines

        public Iterable<String> lines()
        Allow access to this opened file one line at a time.
        Returns:
        an Iterable that will allow access to contents of opened file one line at a time.

      • words

        public Iterable<String> words()
        Allow access to this opened file one word at a time, where words are separated by white-space. This means any form of spaces, like tabs or newlines, can delimit words.
        Returns:
        an Iterable that will allow access to contents of opened file one word at a time.

      • asString

        public String asString()
        Return entire contents of this opened file as one string.
        Returns:
        a String that is the contents of the open file

      • getCSVParser

        public CSVParser getCSVParser()
        Returns a CSVParser object to access the contents of an open file. Each line of the file should be formatted as data separated by commas and with a header row to describe the column names.
        Returns:
        a CSVParser that can provide access to the records in the file one at a time
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if this file does not represent a CSV formatted data

      • getCSVParser

        public CSVParser getCSVParser​(boolean withHeader)
        Returns a CSVParser object to access the contents of an open file, possibly without a header row. Each line of the file should be formatted as data separated by commas and with/without a header row to describe the column names.
        Parameters:
        withHeader - uses first row of data as a header row only if true
        Returns:
        a CSVParser that can provide access to the records in the file one at a time
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if this file does not represent a CSV formatted data

      • getCSVParser

        public CSVParser getCSVParser​(boolean withHeader,
                              String delimiter)
        Returns a CSVParser object to access the contents of an open file, possibly without a header row and a different data delimiter than a comma. Each line of the file should be formatted as data separated by the delimiter passed as a parameter and with/without a header row to describe the column names. This is useful if the data is separated by some character other than a comma.
        Parameters:
        withHeader - uses first row of data as a header row only if true
        delimiter - a single character that separates one field of data from another
        Returns:
        a CSVParser that can provide access to the records in the file one at a time
        Throws:
        ResourceException - if this file does not represent a CSV formatted data
        ResourceException - if delimiter.length() != 1

      • getCSVHeaders

        public Iterable<String> getCSVHeaders​(CSVParser parser)
        Allows access to the column names of the header row of a CSV file (the first line in the file) one at a time. If the CSV file did not have a header row, then an empty Iterator is returned.
        Parameters:
        parser - the CSVParser that has been created for this file
        Returns:
        an Iterable that allows access one header name at a time

      • write

        public void write​(String s)
        Writes a string to the end of this file.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to saved to the file

      • write

        public void write​(StorageResource list)
        Writes a list of strings to the end of this file, one element per line.
        Parameters:
        list - the strings to saved to the file

      • write

        public void write​(String[] list)
        Writes a list of strings to the end of this file, one element per line.
        Parameters:
        list - the strings to saved to the file

      • write

        public void write​(ArrayList<String> list)
        Writes a list of strings to the end of this file, one element per line.
        Parameters:
        list - the strings to saved to the file
